# Scale: Harmonic in B

## Brief Presentation
The Harmonic minor scale is a variation of the natural minor scale with a raised seventh degree. In the key of B, the Harmonic minor scale consists of the notes B, C#, D, E, F#, G, and A#. When played in the C shape, starting from the B note, the fretting pattern follows the shape of a C chord. This scale has a unique flavor, often used to create exotic and dramatic sounds in various genres of music.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (B)
- Major 2nd (C#)
- Minor 3rd (D)
- Perfect 4th (E)
- Perfect 5th (F#)
- Minor 6th (G)
- Major 7th (A#)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Harmonic minor scale is commonly used in genres like metal, flamenco, and some forms of classical music. It gives a rich and exotic sound due to the augmented 2nd interval between the minor 6th and major 7th degrees, creating a tense and suspenseful feel. This scale often evokes a sense of mystery and drama in musical compositions.
